title: These Style Mavens Show You the Best Ways to Wear Winter Whites This Season
text: Once upon a time, there was a dreaded, overwrought fashion rule that whites, creams, and ivories had to be reserved for a small window of the calendar year (and that small window was summer). I’m here to report, thankfully, that those days are behind us. Now, cold weather is here, and the full spectrum of white hues is fair game, which means it’s time to discuss winter white outfit ideas. Over the past month, I’ve seen all-white ensembles executed in an array of iterations. From monochrome looks fit for the slopes to standout dresses festive enough for parties, fashion lovers and celebrities alike are embracing the chic neutral for the season, each with their own twist on the aesthetic. If you need a little help to coax out your inner ice princess, look no further. The ensembles below will give you all the inspiration you need to pull those lighter hues out of hibernation. Ahead, browse some of my favorite white outfits for winter. Tonal Dressinggetty imagesEvery winter mood board I’ve created thus far features multi-toned elements that creatively pair tones and textures. Whether you’re combining denim and wool, or “eggshell” and “vanilla,” mix and match however your heart desires. St. Agni Petit Shell Pouch Apparis Esti Pluche Faux Fur Tote Almada Label Aia Turtleneck Sweater Sprwmn Yoko Carpenter DenimIllesteva LisbonRue Sophie Gaultier Tailored Wool CoatFluff & Fur getty images Could there be anything more glamorous than a fantastically fluffy faux fur coat for winter? I think not. Just imagine the way it’ll move in the winter breeze. Pair it with timeless basics—your coat is the moment, here.The Frankie Shop Liza Faux Fur CoatPerfect Moment Compression LeggingLeset James Turtleneck RegularCos Slouched Leather Knee-High Boots St. Agni Origami ToteDucie Iva Ear MuffsBundled Upgetty imagesCapes are taking over street style—and my Instagram feed. I’ve never been more eager to add something new to my wardrobe. Defined and elegant, a bundled-up look doesn’t have to be frumpy and baggy. Helsa The Detachable Scarf TopDonni The Pleated TrouserNow 28% OffAedye Kirsten FlatNow 30% OffChimi Amelia Gray One SunglassesCou Cou Intimates The CardiganPerfect Moment BalaclavaSuave Suiting getty imagesDon’t shy away from tailored suiting when executing an all-white look. Personally, I like a matching three-piece set. It’s chic, practical, and hassle-free. But if you want to dress things down, try an oversized ivory blazer with jeans or stirrup leggings.Saint Art Dylan Tuxedo JacketSaint Art Isla Waistcoat Saint Art Cait Mid-Rise Straight Leg Tuxedo Pant Etro Medium Saturno BagToteme Leather PumpsSoko Twisted Dash RingPrinted getty imagesHot off the press: Animal print is forever. No matter your preference (Nicole Richie and I are both partial to Dalmatian), use this cheat code to elevate any of your winter dressing needs—especially if your wardrobe lacks statement pieces. Bardot Dorothea Faux Fur Coat Eterne Long Sleeve Turtleneck Maxi DressFemme LA G63 Slingback PumpVada Ozark Tsatsas Medium Reversible Shoulder Bag Now 100% OffIsabel Marant Silvia Leather Wrap BeltGo-To Base LayersGetty ImagesWhite outwear isn’t always the most practical, especially if you don’t want to spend every paycheck at the dry cleaners. Instead, keep your inner layers clean and crisp underneath your non-white essentials, like a black puffer or wool jacket like Zoe Saldana. Then, after the coat check, it’s back to bright whites.Eterne Emma Butter Rib SkirtNaked Cashmere Campbell Ribbed CrewneckBlack Suede Studio Friday 80 Boots Wardrobe.NYC Bonded CoatHeaven Mayhem Beanie Earrings Now 28% OffThe Attico Thea Narrow SunglassesEasy Knitwear Getty ImagesIf there’s one thing I want to be in the winter, it’s cozy. And the main ingredient in “cozy” is knitwear—particularly in the form of a coordinated set, as seen on Havana Rose Liu. My biggest tip is to invest in luxe materials and handle your knits with care, which means taking the time to read the garment instructions. It’s romantic, airy, and ridiculously effortless. It might take time to reprogram your brain away from summer/bridal associations, but smooth white silk—adequately paired with warm layers, of course—is an obvious answer to every date or party coming up on your calendar.Calvin Klein Viscose Satin Maxi Slip DressNow 50% OffCredit: Calvin KleinAeyde Off-White Clara HeelsElleme Small BoomerangKinn Studio Athena Sculptural Ring Stack8 Other Reasons Crescent Hair Tie Lamarque Sarita Leather Maxi CoatCredit: LamarqueWhy Trust ELLEEvery product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. html:
Once upon a time, there was a dreaded, overwrought fashion rule that whites, creams, and ivories had to be reserved for a small window of the calendar year (and that small window was summer). I’m here to report, thankfully, that those days are behind us. Now, cold weather is here, and the full spectrum of white hues is fair game, which means it’s time to discuss winter white outfit ideas.

Over the past month, I’ve seen all-white ensembles executed in an array of iterations. From monochrome looks fit for the slopes to standout dresses festive enough for parties, fashion lovers and celebrities alike are embracing the chic neutral for the season, each with their own twist on the aesthetic.

If you need a little help to coax out your inner ice princess, look no further. The ensembles below will give you all the inspiration you need to pull those lighter hues out of hibernation. Ahead, browse some of my favorite white outfits for winter.

Tonal Dressing

Every winter mood board I’ve created thus far features multi-toned elements that creatively pair tones and textures. Whether you’re combining denim and wool, or “eggshell” and “vanilla,” mix and match however your heart desires.

St. Agni Petit Shell Pouch

Apparis Esti Pluche Faux Fur Tote

Almada Label Aia Turtleneck Sweater

Sprwmn Yoko Carpenter Denim

Illesteva Lisbon

Rue Sophie Gaultier Tailored Wool Coat

Fluff & Fur

Could there be anything more glamorous than a fantastically fluffy faux fur coat for winter? I think not. Just imagine the way it’ll move in the winter breeze. Pair it with timeless basics—your coat is the moment, here.

The Frankie Shop Liza Faux Fur Coat

Perfect Moment Compression Legging

Leset James Turtleneck Regular

Cos Slouched Leather Knee-High Boots

St. Agni Origami Tote

Ducie Iva Ear Muffs

Bundled Up

Capes are taking over street style—and my Instagram feed. I’ve never been more eager to add something new to my wardrobe. Defined and elegant, a bundled-up look doesn’t have to be frumpy and baggy.

Helsa The Detachable Scarf Top

Donni The Pleated Trouser

Now 28% Off

Aedye Kirsten Flat

Now 30% Off

Chimi Amelia Gray One Sunglasses

Cou Cou Intimates The Cardigan

Perfect Moment Balaclava

Suave Suiting

Don’t shy away from tailored suiting when executing an all-white look. Personally, I like a matching three-piece set. It’s chic, practical, and hassle-free. But if you want to dress things down, try an oversized ivory blazer with jeans or stirrup leggings.

Saint Art Dylan Tuxedo Jacket

Saint Art Isla Waistcoat

Saint Art Cait Mid-Rise Straight Leg Tuxedo Pant

Etro Medium Saturno Bag

Toteme Leather Pumps

Soko Twisted Dash Ring

Printed

Hot off the press: Animal print is forever. No matter your preference (Nicole Richie and I are both partial to Dalmatian), use this cheat code to elevate any of your winter dressing needs—especially if your wardrobe lacks statement pieces.

Bardot Dorothea Faux Fur Coat

Eterne Long Sleeve Turtleneck Maxi Dress

Femme LA G63 Slingback Pump

Vada Ozark

Tsatsas Medium Reversible Shoulder Bag

Now 100% Off

Isabel Marant Silvia Leather Wrap Belt

Go-To Base Layers

White outwear isn’t always the most practical, especially if you don’t want to spend every paycheck at the dry cleaners. Instead, keep your inner layers clean and crisp underneath your non-white essentials, like a black puffer or wool jacket like Zoe Saldana. Then, after the coat check, it’s back to bright whites.

Eterne Emma Butter Rib Skirt

Naked Cashmere Campbell Ribbed Crewneck

Black Suede Studio Friday 80 Boots

Wardrobe.NYC Bonded Coat

Heaven Mayhem Beanie Earrings

Now 28% Off

The Attico Thea Narrow Sunglasses

Easy Knitwear

If there’s one thing I want to be in the winter, it’s cozy. And the main ingredient in “cozy” is knitwear—particularly in the form of a coordinated set, as seen on Havana Rose Liu. My biggest tip is to invest in luxe materials and handle your knits with care, which means taking the time to read the garment instructions. (Yes, I’m talking to you!)

Gucci Interlocking G Wool-Blend Bouclé Jacket

Gucci Interlocking G Wool-Blend Bouclé Miniskirt

Flore Flore Steffi Tee

Chanel Moccasins Patent Calfskin

Toteme T-Lock Grain Leather Clutch

SHASHI Timeless Hoops

Sultry Silks

Is any fabric better for playing dress-up than silk? It’s romantic, airy, and ridiculously effortless. It might take time to reprogram your brain away from summer/bridal associations, but smooth white silk—adequately paired with warm layers, of course—is an obvious answer to every date or party coming up on your calendar.

Calvin Klein Viscose Satin Maxi Slip Dress

Now 50% Off

Aeyde Off-White Clara Heels

Elleme Small Boomerang

Kinn Studio Athena Sculptural Ring Stack

8 Other Reasons Crescent Hair Tie

Lamarque Sarita Leather Maxi Coat
